question: I flop and bounce and swing around on the floor or on some sticks and I sometimes look like I don’t have bones. I desperately need a white powder to do what needs to be done, and looking at me you might wonder why I look like I am about to go swimming. Who am I?

I carry a lot of secrets, happy or sad, I drive or walk to my destination rain or shine to make sure I give you what is truly yours. Everything that I bring with me is destined for only for one place which is decided in advance. Who am I?
I can laugh, I can cry, I can be the flying hero in the sky, I can be the devil, I can be be a saint, I can do just about anything what you want me to be and I still get paid. Who am I?
I can be scary, I can be entertaining, I cover my face so it will be impossible for you to recognize me and I create animals from plastic. Who am I?

I purposefully give you problems yet I can also help you solve your problems, I give you instructions and guide yet I criticize you and point out your mistakes as well. I may know numbers, I may know how to sing or dance and anything in between. Who am I?
I can take the role of an electrician, a carpenter, a pipe lifter or a driver. I may even carry you, and if I do, you might just call me a hero. You can count on me any time of the day. Who am I?
I travel, entertain, I am also called the boss, the guardian or the chief and many times I have to make the most and the biggest decisions. Who am I?

I can help a minor, I can help a senior, I can take care of you and no matter what your mood is and I always give you a happy face. I probably won’t give you any advice, but I am always grateful when you give me tips. Who am I?
I wash, cut and shave a dozen times a day yet I still have lots of hair. Who am I?
mother but I have no son, no daughter nor a husband. Who am I?
We work in pairs, we drive around, we take and pick up what you don’t want. Who are we?

I have to communicate with different people, and always keep them in the loop on important matters. I deal with a lot of buttons, knobs and numbers. I am surrounded by metal and I have a duty to carry humans with safety and comfort. Who am I?
Hey! Look over there! Didn’t look? Then you might just be worthy of these tricky riddles

I whip and splash and flip all sorts of things. I mix and combine so much. And what I do is considered an art that after I make it everybody wants to take part. And when they do everything that I made is completely destroyed and ripped apart, which I am very pleased to see. Who am I?
I can take parts of Africa, Egypt, Argentina and almost any part of the world in my hands and shove them into a box and move them all around. Who am I?

Sometime I am Cupids you are so relieved to see me, and other times you run from me in fear. Sometimes I stop you and sometimes I let you go, but whenever you need me I am always a quick call away. Who am I?
I tap and I spin, I wiggle and I twist, and my movements are dictated by external sounds. Who am I?
I made little critters swarm, I made bits of ice burn, I killed a bunch of cows and even made water retreat from me. Who am I?
I make something that I can destroy too, I cut and shape things that could’ve been used for a barbeque. Who am I?
I greet you with my best smile, and you bring me whatever you’d like. I punch and hit a bunch of buttons and when it’s all said and done we make a fair trade. Who am I?
Wow! You made it this far? You…are…awesome. Why not give these science riddles
I am small, I have wings, I carry a weapon. I target people and once I do, they’re usually glad I did. Who am I?
I married your sister, I married your coworker, I may have even married you, and I marry more people all the time, yet I have not gotten a divorce and I am still single. Who am I?

I can be the father or I can be the son, we go by the same name. Hearing my name you might think I am related to a tree or a flower. And I was once a very important figure in the United States. Who am I?
Make those silly teenage years a bit more fun with these riddles for teens
sister but I may not have any siblings. Who am I?
My favorite foods are beer and doughnuts, I went to space and won a Grammy, I love to fall asleep at work and I am a father of 3. Who am I?
born warrior, a princess and I have a rope that can destroy lies. Who am I?
father but I don’t have a child nor a wife. Who am I?
Need to rest your incredible brain? Check out these of easy riddles
I have wings and a wand and when you lose something gross l make sure to leave you the prize that you deserve. Who am I?
I am blue, I am number 1, I am friends with Percy and Toby and you’ll for sure hear me when I come. Who am I?
man but I swing from place to place  and walk upside down just like a critter. Who am I?
I travel with deer all over the world and make the night special for all boys and girls. I happily drink milk and eat your cookies and then I give you all sorts of goodies. Who am I?
I like to take trips and solve problems, puzzles and riddles along the way. I am never alone because my monkey friend will always accompany me. Who am I?
I am grew up outside society, I am wild, my voice echoes throughout the jungle and nature is my playground. Who am I?
You are my sister but I am not your sister but somehow we are siblings. Who am I?
You go at red, but stop at green. What am I?
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
I have a head and a tail that will never meet. Having too many of me is always a treat. What am I?
I help you from your head to your toe. The more I work, the smaller I grow. What am I?
No wings or eyes
answer: I can fly but have no wings

question: I’m (usually) white and used for cutting and grinding. When I’m damaged, humans usually remove me or fill me. For most animals I am a useful tool. What am I?
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. What am I?
I’m where yesterday follows today and tomorrow is in the middle. What am I?
I’m a god, a planet, and I measure heat. What am I?
I can never be thrown but I can be caught. Ways to lose me are always being sought. What am I?
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk or leaves. What am I?
A seed with three letters in my name. Take away two and I still sound the same. What am I?
I’m an instrument through which sounds are made, and yet, not something that can be played. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I have many teeth but I can’t bite. I’m often used early but rarely at night. What am I?
I have two hands, but I can not scratch myself. What am I?
I am the beginning of everything, the end of everywhere. I’m the beginning of eternity, the end of time and space. What am I?
I can wave my hands at you, but I never say goodbye. You are always cool when with me, even more so when I am high! What am I?
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you haven’t got me. What am I?
What can be heard and caught but never seen?
I follow you all the time and copy your every move, but you can’t touch me or catch me. What am I?
Always in you, Sometimes on you; If I surround you, I can kill you. What am I?
My life can be measured in hours, I serve by being devoured. Thin, I am quick. Fat, I am slow. Wind is my foe. What am I?
People buy me to eat, but never eat me. What am I?
People make me, save me, change me, raise me. What am I?
I am served at a table, In gatherings of two or four. Served small, white, and round. You’ll love some, and that’s part of the fun. What am I?
The more you take away, the more I become. What am I?
I have lakes with no water, mountains with no stone, and cities with no buildings. What am I?
I’m tall when I’m young, I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
I have 13 hearts, but no other organs? What am I?
I have eyes but I can’t see. I live in the dark until you need me. What am I?
I can be cracked, I can be made. I can be told, I can be played. What am I?
What is as light as a feather, yet no person can hold it for long. What am I?
Forward I am heavy, but backward I am not. What am I?
You heard me before, and then again. Afterward, I die, until you call me again. What am I?
Take off my skin and I won’t cry, but you will! What am I?
If you drop me I’m sure to crack, but give me a smile and I’ll always smile back. What am I?
I have a bed but I never sleep. I have a mouth but I never speak. What am I?
I have a little house in which I live all alone. It has no doors or windows, and if I want to go out I must break through the wall. What am I?
answer: Answer: A baby chick in an egg

question: I am always hungry and will die if not fed, but whatever I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
Two in a corner, 1 in a room, 0 in a house, but 1 in a shelter. What am I?
I sound like one letter but I’m written with three. I show you things when you look through me. What am I?
